chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
exists ! f : forall X : Type, FiniteT X -> nat, f False empty_finite = 0 /\ (forall (X : Type) (H : FiniteT X), f (option X) (add_finite X H) = S (f X H)) /\ (forall (X Y : Type) (H : FiniteT X) (g : X -> Y) (Hinv : invertible g), f Y (bij_finite X Y g H Hinv) = f X H)

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type
Inductive invertible (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) : Prop := intro_invertible : forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f Arguments invertible {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_invertible {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T)
Inductive FiniteT : Type -> Prop := empty_finite : FiniteT False | add_finite : forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> FiniteT (option T) | bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y Arguments FiniteT _%type_scope Arguments add_finite _%type_scope Arguments bij_finite (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive False : Prop := 
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
bij_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> invertible f -> FiniteT Y
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
FiniteT_nat_cardinal_bijection : forall (X Y : Type) (H : FiniteT X) (g : X -> Y) (Hinv : invertible g), FiniteT_nat_cardinal Y (bij_finite X Y g H Hinv) = FiniteT_nat_cardinal X H
FiniteT_nat_cardinal_option : forall (X : Type) (H : FiniteT X), FiniteT_nat_cardinal (option X) (add_finite X H) = S (FiniteT_nat_cardinal X H)
bijective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => injective f /\ surjective f : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments bijective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
inj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT Y -> injective f -> (forall y : Y, (exists x : X, f x = y) \/ ~ (exists x : X, f x = y)) -> FiniteT X
FiniteT_nat_cardinal_def : forall (X : Type) (H : FiniteT X), cardinal X Full_set (FiniteT_nat_cardinal X H)
surj_finite : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> surjective f -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> FiniteT Y
finite_inj_surj : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X), FiniteT X -> injective f -> surjective f
finite_surj_inj : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> X), FiniteT X -> surjective f -> injective f
invertible_sind : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : SProp), (forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> P) -> invertible f -> P
invertible_ind : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : Prop), (forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> P) -> invertible f -> P
finite_exp : forall X Y : Type, FiniteT X -> FiniteT Y -> FiniteT (X -> Y)
finite_prod : forall X Y : Type, FiniteT X -> FiniteT Y -> FiniteT (X * Y)
finite_sum : forall X Y : Type, FiniteT X -> FiniteT Y -> FiniteT (X + Y)
FiniteT_nat_cardinal_cond : forall (X : Type) (H : FiniteT X) (n : nat), cardinal X Full_set n -> FiniteT_nat_cardinal X H = n
injection_preserves_cardinal : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (n : nat) (S : Ensemble X), cardinal X S n -> injective f -> cardinal Y (Im S f) n
FiniteT_ind : forall P : Type -> Prop, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
FiniteT_sind : forall P : Type -> SProp, P False -> (forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T -> P (option T)) -> (forall (X Y : Type) (f1 : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> P X -> invertible f1 -> P Y) -> forall T : Type, FiniteT T -> P T
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
FiniteT_img : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), FiniteT X -> (forall y1 y2 : Y, y1 = y2 \/ y1 <> y2) -> Finite Y (Im Full_set f)
FiniteT_has_nat_cardinal : forall X : Type, FiniteT X -> exists ! n : nat, cardinal X Full_set n
Decidable.dec_functional_relation : forall (X Y : Type) (A : X -> Y -> Prop), (forall y y' : Y, Decidable.decidable (y = y')) -> (forall x : X, exists ! y : Y, A x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), Decidable.decidable (A x y)
finite_subtype : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, P x \/ ~ P x) -> FiniteT {x : X | P x}
unique_inverse : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, invertible f -> exists ! g : ?Y -> ?X, (forall x : ?X, g (f x) = x) /\ (forall y : ?Y, f (g y) = y) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
FiniteT_nat_cardinal_False = FiniteT_nat_cardinal_cond False empty_finite 0 (let H : Full_set = Empty_set := Extensionality_Ensembles Full_set Empty_set (conj (fun (x : False) (H : In Full_set x) => match x as f return (In Full_set f -> In Empty_set f) with end H) (Empty_set_minimal False Full_set)) in eq_ind_r (fun e : Ensemble False => cardinal False e 0) (card_empty False) H) : FiniteT_nat_cardinal False empty_finite = 0
Im_intro : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (x : U), In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im X f) y
FiniteT_nat_cardinal : forall X : Type, FiniteT X -> nat
function_inverse : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, invertible f -> {g : ?Y -> ?X | (forall x : ?X, g (f x) = x) /\ (forall y : ?Y, f (g y) = y)} where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
finite_dec_forall : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {forall x : X, P x} + {exists x : X, ~ P x}
finite_dec_exists : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), FiniteT X -> (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {exists x : X, P x} + {forall x : X, ~ P x}
finite_cardinal : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), Finite U X -> exists n : nat, cardinal U X n
